q:
Which of the following C# code snippets can you use to rewrite the C# code given below using String Interpolation?

Code:

string Age = "<Type your age here>";
string dateString = DateTime.Today.ToShortDateString();

string s = "Hello. You are " + Age + " + "years old". Today is " + dateString + ".";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

s += " How do you feel?";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

 

 

Code Snippets

1. 

string Age = "<Type your age here>";
string dateString = DateTime.Today.ToShortDateString();

string s = $"Hello. You are {Age} years old. Today is {dateString}.";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

s = $"{s} How do you feel?";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

 

2.

string Age = "<Type your age here>";
string dateString = DateTime.Today.ToShortDateString();

string s = "Hello. You are" ${Age} "years old. Today is" ${dateString}.;
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

s = ${s} "How do you feel?";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

 

3.

string Age = "<Type your age here>";
string dateString = DateTime.Today.ToShortDateString();

string s = "Hello. You are" ${Age}$ "years old. Today is" ${dateString}$.;
System.Console.WriteLine(s);

s = ${s}$ "How do you feel?";
System.Console.WriteLine(s);
